metadata.Title: CVE-2013-2487 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
epan/dissectors/packet-reload.c in the REsource LOcation And Discovery (akaRELOAD) dissector in Wireshark 1.8.x before 1.8.6 uses incorrect integerdata types, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(infinite loop) via crafted integer values in a packet, related to the (1)dissect_icecandidates, (2) dissect_kinddata, (3) dissect_nodeid_list, (4)dissect_storeans, (5) dissect_storereq, (6) dissect_storeddataspecifier,(7) dissect_fetchreq, (8) dissect_findans, (9) dissect_diagnosticinfo, (10)dissect_diagnosticresponse, (11) dissect_reload_messagecontents, and (12)dissect_reload_message functions, a different vulnerability thanCVE-2013-2486.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-2487` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 1.10.6-1
libwireshark3 - 1.10.6-1
libwiretap3 - 1.10.6-1
libwsutil3 - 1.10.6-1
tshark - 1.10.6-1
wireshark - 1.10.6-1
wireshark-common - 1.10.6-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.6-1').
